# Quick Fix: Products Domain Skeleton Loading Components
Generated: 2026-01-17T13:44:30

## Change Made

Implemented skeleton loading components for the products domain following the plan at `renoz-v3/thoughts/shared/plans/products-skeleton-loading-plan.md`.

## Files Created

### 1. Core Components

#### `src/components/skeletons/skeleton-cell.tsx`
- Reusable skeleton cell component with 9 variants
- Variants: checkbox, text, avatar-text, icon-text, badge, tags, icon, price, status
- Uses base Skeleton primitive with animate-pulse
- Configurable width via Tailwind classes

#### `src/components/skeletons/products/table-skeleton.tsx`
- ProductTableSkeleton for list view
- Matches actual table column structure (Name, Price, Unit, Usage, Last Used, Status, Actions)
- Optional filter bar skeleton (search + 2 filters + action button)
- Configurable row count (default: 8)
- Fixed row height (65px) to match actual table

#### `src/components/skeletons/products/detail-skeleton.tsx`
- ProductDetailSkeleton for detail view
- Header section with breadcrumb, title, subtitle, action buttons
- Two-column layout (2/3 tabs + 1/3 pricing/meta)
- Integrates TabsSkeleton and PricingCardSkeleton
- Responsive grid layout (stacks on mobile)

#### `src/components/skeletons/products/pricing-card-skeleton.tsx`
- PricingCardSkeleton for pricing cards
- Two layouts: horizontal (scrollable) and grid
- Card structure: header with badge, price display, feature list (3 items), action button
- Configurable count (default: 1)

#### `src/components/skeletons/shared/tabs-skeleton.tsx`
- Reusable TabsSkeleton for tabbed interfaces
- Tab list with configurable tab count (default: 4)
- Generic tab content placeholder (heading + 3 text lines)

### 2. Barrel Exports

#### `src/components/skeletons/index.ts`
```typescript
export * from "./skeleton-cell";
export * from "./products";
export * from "./shared";
```

#### `src/components/skeletons/products/index.ts`
```typescript
export { ProductTableSkeleton } from "./table-skeleton";
export { ProductDetailSkeleton } from "./detail-skeleton";
export { PricingCardSkeleton } from "./pricing-card-skeleton";
```

#### `src/components/skeletons/shared/index.ts`
```typescript
export { TabsSkeleton } from "./tabs-skeleton";
```

## Verification

- Syntax check: PASS (components compile in project context)
- Pattern followed: Matches existing UI components and plan specifications
- All components use existing primitives (Skeleton, Card, Table)
- Animation: Uses `animate-pulse` from base Skeleton component

## Usage Example

```typescript
import { Suspense } from "react";
import {
  ProductTableSkeleton,
  ProductDetailSkeleton
} from "~/components/skeletons";

// In products list route
function ProductsPage() {
  return (
    <Suspense fallback={<ProductTableSkeleton />}>
      <ProductsTable />
    </Suspense>
  );
}

// In product detail route
function ProductDetailPage() {
  return (
    <Suspense fallback={<ProductDetailSkeleton />}>
      <ProductDetail />
    </Suspense>
  );
}
```

## Files Modified

None. This is a greenfield implementation of new components.

## Notes

- Components follow the "use client" directive for React client components
- All dimensions match the plan specifications
- Skeletons are designed to minimize layout shift when content loads
- Components are reusable across the products domain
- Shared components (TabsSkeleton) can be reused in other domains
